Kayako - ticket id 60100448 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear David,

Thank you for your follow-up and for providing the screenshot confirming the update behavior on your Kerio Control Box NG110.

1) Compatibility List for NG Units with Kerio Control 9.5.0
As of the latest available information, there is no official compatibility list published by GFI that includes the NG110 series as supported for Kerio Control version 9.5.0 or later. The NG110 appliance is supported up to the 9.4.x branch. This is reflected in the fact that version 9.5.0 is not offered via automatic updates or visible in the Webadmin interface for this hardware model. If GFI announces any changes to hardware compatibility in the future, such updates will be published in the official Kerio Control Release Notes [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us/articles/117070-Kerio-Control-9-4-Release-Notes] and on the Kerio Control support portal [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us]. At this time, you should plan for the NG110 to remain on the 9.4.x branch.

2) Upgrade Behavior and Patch Installation Issue
Your screenshot confirms that the system detects and offers "Kerio Control 9.4.5 Patch 2" as an available update, but the upgrade process fails—after attempted installation, the device remains on version 9.4.5 build 8629, and the update continues to be offered. This behavior indicates that the appliance is not successfully applying the patch, despite the update mechanism functioning and sufficient disk space being available.

Based on your description and the file analysis, here are the key points and recommendations:

 	* Patch File vs. Full Image: The file you manually uploaded (kerio-control-upgrade-9.4.5-8629-linux.img) is the full image for version 9.4.5 build 8629, which matches your current installed version. To upgrade to Patch 2, you must use the specific patch file for 9.4.5 Patch 2, if available for your hardware. Uploading the same version image will not trigger an upgrade or resolve the patch installation issue.
 	* Patch Availability: If the 9.4.5 Patch 2 file is not available for download for the NG110 from the official Kerio archive, it is likely that this patch is not officially supported or released for your appliance model. This is a common scenario for hardware appliances that have reached the end of their supported upgrade path.
 	* Upgrade Safeguards: The persistent offer of the patch and the failure to apply it, with no error messages or log entries, suggest that the appliance firmware is preventing the upgrade due to compatibility or integrity checks. This is a built-in safeguard to ensure system stability and prevent unsupported upgrades.
 	* Log Availability: On some NG appliances, the "system" log may not be present or may be named differently. If no relevant errors are found in other logs and the upgrade continues to fail, this further supports the likelihood of a compatibility safeguard at work.

Summary of Recommendations:

 	* The NG110 is not supported for Kerio Control 9.5.0 or later, and there is no official compatibility list indicating future support for these versions on NG110 hardware.
 	* To upgrade to 9.4.5 Patch 2, ensure you are using the correct patch file specifically for your appliance. If such a file is not available, the patch is not supported for your model.
 	* The repeated failure to apply the patch, with no errors and sufficient disk space, indicates a firmware safeguard is preventing the upgrade—this is expected behavior for unsupported or restricted updates on NG hardware.
 	* For reference, you can review the Kerio Control 9.4 Release Notes [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us/articles/117070-Kerio-Control-9-4-Release-Notes] for details on supported versions and hardware.

If you have further questions about supported versions or require clarification on available upgrade files, please let us know. We are here to assist with any additional guidance you may need regarding your NG110 appliance.

Sincerely,
Atlas
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team.

-------------------------

- This supports the customer's observation that the upgrade is offered but fails to install, as the system continues to present the update as available after attempted upgrades.

Kayako - ticket id 60100448 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear David,

Thank you for your follow-up questions regarding the Kerio Control Box NG110 and the upgrade process.

1) Future Compatibility of NG110 with Kerio Control 9.5.0
As of the latest available information, the Kerio Control Box NG110 series is not supported for Kerio Control version 9.5.0 or later. This is why the 9.5.0 upgrade is not offered via automatic updates or visible in the Webadmin interface for this hardware model. There has been no official announcement from GFI regarding future support for 9.5.0 or later versions on the NG110 platform. Historically, hardware appliances like the NG110 are supported only up to specific software versions due to hardware limitations and end-of-life policies. If there are any changes to this policy in the future, they will be communicated through official Kerio Control release notes and documentation [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us]. At this time, you should plan for the NG110 to remain on the 9.4.x branch.

2) Manual Update Attempt and Log Availability
You have confirmed that you attempted a manual update by uploading kerio-control-upgrade-9.4.5-8629-linux.img, but after reboot, the device remains on version 9.4.5 build 8629. You also noted that there is no "system" log available on the NG110, and no errors are present in other logs, with sufficient disk space available (22GB free).

Given these details, here are some important points and recommendations:

 	* Firmware Version Matching: The file kerio-control-upgrade-9.4.5-8629-linux.img matches the version already installed (9.4.5 build 8629). If you are attempting to upgrade to 9.4.5 Patch 2, please ensure you are using the correct patch file (for example, kerio-control-upgrade-9.4.5-p2-linux.img or similar), as uploading the same version will not result in an upgrade.
 	* Patch File Availability: If you do not see the patch file available for download for the NG110, it may indicate that the patch is not officially released or supported for this hardware. Always verify that the patch or upgrade file is listed as compatible with your appliance model in the Kerio Control 9.4 Release Notes [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us/articles/117070-Kerio-Control-9-4-Release-Notes] or the official download portal.
 	* Log Files: On some hardware appliances, the "system" log may not be present or may be named differently. You can check the "error" or "messages" logs for any entries related to the upgrade process. If no errors are present and the upgrade does not proceed, it is likely due to a safeguard or compatibility check within the appliance firmware.
 	* Upgrade Limitations: If the appliance consistently reverts to the same version after a manual upgrade attempt, and no errors are logged, this typically indicates that the appliance firmware is preventing the upgrade due to compatibility or integrity checks. This is a built-in safety feature to prevent unsupported or potentially harmful upgrades.

Summary:
- The NG110 is not supported for Kerio Control 9.5.0 or later, and there is no indication that this will change in the future.
- Ensure you are using the correct patch file for any upgrade attempts. Uploading the same version will not trigger an upgrade.
- If the correct patch file is not available for your appliance, it is likely not supported.
- The absence of errors and the appliance reverting to the previous version indicate a compatibility safeguard.

If you have any further questions about supported versions or need clarification on available upgrade files, please refer to the Kerio Control 9.4 Release Notes [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us/articles/117070-Kerio-Control-9-4-Release-Notes] or let us know for additional guidance.

Sincerely,
Atlas
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team.

Kayako - ticket id 60100448 // ATLAS commented publicly: Dear David,

Thank you for your detailed description regarding the Kerio Control Box NG110 (Serial: LNKR20070868) and the issues encountered with upgrading from version 9.4.5 build 8629.

1. Compatibility of Kerio Control 9.5.0 with NG110:
As of the latest available information, Kerio Control Box NG110 appliances are supported up to version 9.4.x. The 9.5.0 release is not offered via automatic updates for NG110 hardware because this model is not officially supported for 9.5.0 and later versions. This is why you do not see the 9.5.0 upgrade option in the Webadmin interface. Installing unsupported versions may result in instability or hardware incompatibility.

2. Failed Upgrade to 9.4.5 Patch 2:
If the upgrade to 9.4.5 Patch 2 fails and the device reverts to 9.4.5 build 8629 after a long reboot, this typically indicates that the appliance detected an issue during the upgrade process and automatically rolled back to the previous stable version. Since no error messages were displayed, the most common causes are:

 	* Insufficient disk space on the appliance.
 	* Corrupted upgrade file or interrupted download.
 	* Hardware compatibility issues specific to the NG110 series.

Recommended Steps:

 	* Manual Upgrade Attempt: If you wish to attempt the upgrade again, you can manually download the 9.4.5 Patch 2 firmware from the official Kerio archive and upload it via the Webadmin interface. This can sometimes resolve issues caused by corrupted automatic downloads. However, since the device is remote and you require high confidence, ensure you have a backup of the configuration before proceeding.
 	* Check Disk Space: In the Webadmin interface, review the available disk space on the appliance. If space is low, consider cleaning up old logs or backups before retrying the upgrade.
 	* Review System Logs: After a failed upgrade, check the system logs (Status > Logs > System) for any entries related to the upgrade process. These may provide more insight into the cause of the rollback.

Summary:
- The NG110 appliance is not supported for Kerio Control 9.5.0 or later, which is why the upgrade is not offered.
- The failed upgrade to 9.4.5 Patch 2 is likely due to a system safeguard (such as disk space or file integrity). Manual upgrade and log review are recommended for further troubleshooting.

If you need further guidance on performing a manual upgrade or interpreting log entries, please let us know. For more details on supported versions and release notes, you can refer to the Kerio Control 9.4.3 Patch 2 Release Notes [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/hc/en-us/articles/116092-Kerio-Control-9-4-3-Patch-2-Release-Notes] and related documentation.

Sincerely,
Atlas
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team.

-------------------------

Chat Support:

 Thanks for explaining your situation—especially since the unit is remote, I completely understand wanting to be cautious before attempting a manual upgrade.

Here’s what I found:

- Kerio Control 9.5.0 is officially released and available for download. You can see the release notes here: Kerio Control 9.5.0 Release Notes [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/124668].
- However, there’s no explicit mention in the release notes about hardware compatibility for the NG110 appliance with version 9.5.0. Sometimes, if a version isn’t offered via automatic update, it could be due to hardware compatibility checks, staged rollouts, or other restrictions set by the update server.
- Previous release notes (like for 9.4.4) do mention hardware-specific support and limitations, but there’s no clear statement about NG110 being unsupported for 9.5.0.

Given that:
- If the update isn’t offered automatically, it’s possible that either the update is being rolled out in phases, or there may be a compatibility consideration for your specific hardware.
- Manual upgrades on remote devices always carry some risk, especially if the update isn’t being offered automatically.

My recommendation:
- If you need to minimize risk, it’s best to wait until the update is available via the automatic update channel for your NG110.
- If you must upgrade sooner, I’d suggest reaching out to Kerio/GFI support directly to confirm official compatibility of 9.5.0 with the NG110 before proceeding with a manual update.
